alert.note: Alert for Chattooga; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 6:59PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Walker and northeastern Chattooga Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 659 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Center Post, or 7 miles southwest of Lafayette, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lafayette, Trion, Naomi, Center Post, Subligna, Suttles Mill and Villanow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
